specification.name: Application Cache
specification.description: Resources are saved for offline use using a manifest.

specification.name: Battery Status API
specification.description: An API that provides information about the battery status of the hosting device.

specification.name: Beacon API
specification.description: Schedules asynchronous and non-blocking data delivery while the current page is unloading to mitigate resource contention for other time-critical requests.

specification.name: CSS Color Level 4
specification.description: Allows content to specify colors outside of the sRGB Color Space.

specification.name: CSS Font Display
specification.description: Allows content to specify what is shown during font loading.

specification.name: CSS Image Values and Replaced Content Module Level 4
CSS Properties and Values API Level 1
specification.description: An API for registering new CSS properties. Properties registered using this API are provided with a parse syntax that defines a type, inheritance behaviour, and an initial value.

specification.name: CSS Rhythmic Sizing
specification.description: Allows block content to set a simple grid to which lines will adhere.

specification.name: CSS Scroll Snap Points Module Level 1
CSS Text Decoration Level 4
specification.description: Allows content to specify properties of text decorations such as underlines.

specification.name: CSS Typed OM Level 1
specification.description: Exposes CSS values as typed JavaScript objects to facilitate their performant manipulation.

specification.name: CSS Variables
specification.description: Allows developers to define reusable custom property values.

specification.name: Content Security Policy Level 2
specification.description: A mechanism that web applications can use to mitigate content injection vulnerabilities, such as cross-site scripting (XSS). Developers can declare a CSP policy to prohibit their web application from loading content or executing scripts that have not been whitelisted among other capabilities.

specification.name: DeviceOrientation Events
specification.description: DOM events that provide information about the physical orientation and motion of a hosting device.
specification.comment: compassHeading and compassAccuracy are only available on iOS devices

specification.name: Encoding
specification.description: TextEncoder and TextDecoder APIs for converting text from different character sets.

specification.name: Fetch
specification.description: An underlying unified architecture for making resource requests.

specification.name: Gamepad
specification.description: An interface for accessing and responding to game controller device state.

specification.name: Geolocation API
specification.description: An API that provides scripted access to geographical location information associated with the hosting device.

specification.name: Indexed Database
specification.description: A standard interface to a database of records for simple values and objects. WebKit supports the full W3C recommended standard.

specification.name: Indexed Database 2.0
specification.description: Version 2.0 of the Indexed Database API. We are participating in development of the standard and are implementing new features as they stabilize.

specification.name: Intersection Observer
specification.description: An API that can be used to understand the visibility and position of DOM elements relative to a containing element or to the top-level viewport.

specification.name: Media Capture and Streams
specification.description: A set of JavaScript APIs that allow local media, including audio and video, to be requested.

specification.name: Navigation Timing Level 1
specification.description: An API that exposes page load measurements to the page.

specification.name: Navigation Timing Level 2
specification.description: An API that exposes page load measurements to the page and adds entries to the performance timeline.

specification.name: Performance Observer
specification.description: An API to observe performance timeline entries at idle times.

specification.name: Pointer Events Level 2
specification.description: Pointer Events describes events and related interfaces for handling hardware agnostic pointer input from devices including a mouse, pen, touchscreen, etc.

specification.name: Pointer Lock
specification.description: Provides scripted access to raw mouse movement data while locking the target of mouse events to a single element and removing the cursor from view.

specification.name: Preload
specification.description: Provides a declarative fetch primitive that initiates an early fetch and separates fetching from resource execution.

specification.name: Resource Timing Level 2
specification.description: An API to that provides detailed timing information for resource loads.

specification.name: SVG in OpenType Fonts
specification.description: Allows Scalable Vector Graphics content within font files.

specification.name: Service Workers
specification.description: A method for browsers to run JavaScript in the background to handle network requests and manage cached responses. Service Workers offers a replacement for Application Cache.

specification.name: User Timing Level 2
specification.description: Provides high precision timestamp marking APIs.

specification.name: WOFF File Format 2.0
specification.description: Improves compression to reduce bandwidth with content-aware preprocessing.

specification.name: Web Animations
specification.description: An API to synchronize with the timing for presentation changes of a web page.

specification.name: Web App Manifest
specification.description: A JSON-format manifest file for developers to place metadata associated with a web application.

specification.name: Web Components
specification.description: A collection of technologies to improve modularization of DOM subtrees.

specification.name: Web Cryptography API
specification.description: A JavaScript API for web applications to perform cryptographic operations.

specification.name: WebRTC
specification.description: An API to facilitate real-time communication for browser-to-browser applications.

specification.name: WebVR
specification.description: A JavaScript API providing access to VR devices to allow developers to build comfortable VR experiences.

specification.name: Worklets Level 1
specification.description: An API for running scripts in stages of the rendering pipeline independent of the main javascript execution environment

features.name: CSS Selector :any-link
features.description: The pseudo class :any-link matches any element that would match :link or :visisted.
features.comment: A prefix version :-webkit-any-link has been available for a while but it was not 100% compliant to the specification.

features.name: CSS Selector :focus-within
features.description: The selector :focus-within matches an element if the element or a descendant has the focus.

features.name: CSS Selector :lang() level 4
features.description: The selector :lang() is extended in level 4 to support a list of language range, each range can contain a wildcard. For example: p:lang("*-be", "en").

features.name: CSS Selector :matches()
features.description: The selector :matches() takes a selector list as argument and matches an element if any of them matches (e.g. :matches(article > section, #target)). When used for styling, the specificity of :matches() is the higest specificity of all selectors in the selector list.
features.comment: The pseudo classes :visited and :link are not supported inside :matches().

features.name: CSS Selector :not() level 4
features.description: The selector :not() in level 4 supports full selector lists as argument. For example: :not(:any-link >> img, :any-link >> picture).
features.comment: The pseudo classes :visited and :link are not supported inside :not().

features.name: CSS Selector :nth-child(An+B of selector list) and :nth-last-child(An+B of selector list)
features.description: The pseudo classes :nth-child() and :nth-last-child() now supports a selector list that filters what to count. For example: ":nth-child(even of .visible)".
features.comment: The pseudo classes :visited and :link are not supported inside :nth-child() and :nth-last-child().

features.name: CSS Selector :placeholder-shown
features.description: The selector :placeholder-shown matches any input element that has a visible placeholder.
features.comment: Styling the placeholder can be done through the WebKit pseudo-element "::placeholder".

features.name: CSS Shapes Level 1
features.description: CSS Shapes describe geometric shapes for use in CSS. For Level 1, CSS Shapes can be applied to floats.
features.comment: The implementation is feature complete and shipping, but is -webkit prefixed.

features.name: Case-insensitive attribute selectors
features.description: Any attribute selector that test a value can take a flag "i" to use case insensitive checks. For example: input[type=number i] test the value "number" case-insensitively.

features.name: Conic Gradients
features.specification: CSS Image Values and Replaced Content Module Level 4
features.description: Defines gradients wrapped around a central point.

features.name: Custom Elements
features.description: Define a custom HTML tag and associate it with an ES6 class.

features.name: Datalist Element
features.description: The datalist element represents a set of option elements that represent predefined options for other controls.

features.name: Download Attribute
features.description: An attribute to an anchor or area element to indicate that a resource is intended to be downloaded for use later rather than immediately.

features.name: Element.closest()
features.description: Find the closest ancestor matching the selector passed as argument. The element itself is returned if it matches the selector.

features.name: File and Directory Entries API
features.description: An API to support file and directory upload by drag-and-drop operations.

features.name: Filter Effects backdrop-filter property
features.description: This property specifies styling for filters applied to the backdrop of an element.

features.name: Font Palettes
features.description: Allows setting colors in color fonts from CSS

features.name: Force Click Events
features.description: Provide the events necessary to handle force click events in the page, overriding the default behavior.

features.name: HTML Interactive Form Validation
features.description: Interactive validation of constraints on HTML forms by displaying bubbles with a validation message next to incomplete / invalid form controls.

features.name: HTML imports
features.description: Includes resusable HTML documents in other HTML documents.
features.comment: Multile browser vendors have raised concerns about how the HTML imports currently works. For example, its dependency model is not fully compatible with ES6 Modules. We are exploring other ways to package web components by integrating into ES6 Modules with other browser vendors.

features.name: ImageBitmap
features.description: An interface for drawing bitmap images to a <canvas> without undue latency.

features.name: Initial Letter
features.description: This property specifies styling for dropped, raised, and sunken initial letters.

features.name: Input Events
features.description: Allows pages to override default editing behaviors and to monitor DOM changes due to user input.

features.name: Interaction Media Features (pointer, hover, any-pointer, any-hover)
features.description: The "pointer" media defines how percise the pointing device is. The "hover" media defines the ability of the poiting device to hover elements.

features.name: MediaStream Recording API
features.comment: Allows recording of audio and/or video MediaStream.

features.name: MicroData
features.comment: WebKit used to support MicroData. The feature never gained any traction and was eventually removed to clean up the codebase.

features.name: Payment Request
features.description: An API for merchants to request payments from users.

features.name: Picture element
features.description: Enable handling the art-direction responsive images use-case by defining multiple image sources in markup

features.name: Position: sticky
features.description: Sticky positioning provides a way to position element out of the normal flow when scrolling. Unlike solutions based on JavaScript, the change of position is synchronized with scrolling.
features.comment: The feature is prefixed with -webkit-. There are some remaining issues to resolve in the specification.

features.name: Readable Streams
features.comment: The implementation does not support ReadableStreamBYOBReader.

features.name: Scroll Anchoring
features.description: Maintains page scroll position when content is modified.

features.name: Shadow DOM
features.description: Functional encapsulation of HTML and CSS for Web Components.
features.comment: We are fixing the remainig bugs in our implementation.

features.name: Shared Web Workers
features.comment: The implementation of Shared Web Workers was imposing undesirable constraints on the engine. The feature never gained any adoption and was eventually removed from the engine.

features.name: Srcset w descriptor and related sizes attribute
features.description: Enable handling the variable width responsive images use-case by defining multiple image resources in markup

features.name: Srcset x descriptor
features.description: Enable handling the fixed width responsive images use-case by defining multiple image resources in markup

features.name: Strict Mixed Content Checking
features.description: Allows developers to opt into blocking display and running of all insecure content on an HTTPS page.

features.name: Subresource Integrity
features.description: Extends script and link elements with an integrity attribute that contains a cryptographic hash of the representation of the resource the author expects to load.

features.name: Template Element
features.description: Declares HTML fragments that can be cloned and inserted into the document by a script.

features.name: Upgrade Insecure Requests
features.description: Allows developers to opt into automatic upgrading of insecure requests to secure requests.

features.name: Variation Fonts
features.description: Allows selection of variation values along fonts' exposed axes.

features.name: Vibration API
features.description: An API that provides access to the vibration mechanism of the hosting device.

features.name: Visual Viewport API
features.description: A proposal to add explicit APIs to the Web for querying and setting the visual viewport.

features.name: Web Audio
features.description: A high-level JavaScript API for processing and synthesizing audio in web applications.
features.comment: WebKit's implementation does not match the current specification.

features.name: Web Authentication
features.description: An API enabling the creation and use of strong, attested, cryptographic scoped credentials by web applications, for the purpose of strongly authenticating users.

features.name: Web Bluetooth
features.description: An API to discover and communicate with devices over the Bluetooth.

features.name: Web MIDI
features.description: An API supporting the Musical Instrument Digital Interface (MIDI) protocol, enabling web applications to enumerate and select MIDI input and output devices on the client system and send and receive MIDI messages.

features.name: Web Share
features.description: An API to allow content from the page to be exposed to platform sharing APIs.

features.name: WebUSB
features.description: An an API for securely providing access to Universal Serial Bus devices from web pages.

features.name: requestIdleCallback
features.description: An API that can be used to cooperatively schedule background tasks.
